articles.description: Private pathology companies threatened to refuse COVID-19 testing at the height of the pandemic, forcing the federal government to increase by four-fold its payment for each test.
articles.content: In Victoria, where the Andrews government is using roadside advertising to ask people to get tested, the state's testing "blitz" was heralded as a way to collect the data required to make decisions on the reopening of schools and lifting of social restriction… [+4439 chars]

articles.author: Jamie Seidel
articles.title: Coronavirus: Man gives 52 people virus in 2.5 hours at choir practice - NEWS.com.au
articles.description: Coronavirus: Man gives 52 people virus in 2.5 hours at choir practice
articles.content:
Who could have guessed choirs could be killers? We suspect simply talking can transmit COVID-19. But singing, it seems, is a projectile weapon. COVID-19 doesn’t meet all the criteria to be classified as an airborne disease.
But it gets close.
Coughing and s… [+5614 chars]

articles.author: Brooke Rolfe
articles.title: Suspicious case of 'extremely contagious' disease emerges - Yahoo News Australia
articles.description: A woman was bitten by a wild animal earlier this year and later tested positive to the rare disease.
articles.content:
A rare and highly contagious disease suspected of being caused by a wild animal has been detected in a NSW resident, sparking a serious warning from health authorities.
A woman, from a suburb in Northern Sydney, contracted a disease called tularaemia after b… [+2283 chars]
